container-title: ENGLISH TRANSLATIONS The nineteenth-century translations vary greatly in readability. Those of Philip Pusey, undertaken under the direction of his father for the Library of the Fathers of the Church, are so literal as to be sometimes quite impenetrable without reference to the Greek. The first publication was that of R.Payne-Smith, A Commentary Upon the Gospel According to S.Luke by Cyril, Patriarch of Alexandria
